summary:
The Commonwealth Games is a big sports event held every four years for countries that were once part of the British Empire. It started in 1930 and has changed names a few times. In 2002, it became the first major sports event to include disabled athletes as full members. The games have also led the way in gender equality, with more women's events than men's since 2022.

The games feature popular Commonwealth sports like netball and lawn bowls, along with Olympic and Paralympic events. Around 4,500 athletes compete in 25 sports.

Australia has hosted the games five times, more than any other country. The most recent games were in Birmingham in 2022, and the next ones will be in Glasgow in 2026.
title: Commonwealth Games
